Member Enumeration Documentation

◆ Attitude

enum Creature::Attitude : int

Simplified attitude towards any creature: hostile - hate, want to kill, etc.

neutral - anything between. friendly - avoid harming it, maybe even help. any - any of the above, used in safemode_ui

◆ auto_find_hostile_target()

Creature * Creature::auto_find_hostile_target ( int  range,
int &  boo_hoo,
int  area = 0 
)

For fake-players (turrets, mounted turrets) this functions chooses a target.

This is for creatures that are friendly towards the player and therefor choose a target that is hostile to the player.

Parameters
rangeThe maximal range to look for monsters, anything outside of that range is ignored.
boo_hooThe number of targets that have been skipped because the player is in the way.
areaThe area of effect of the projectile aimed.

387 if( is_fake() && in_veh ) {
388 // If turret in the vehicle then
389 // Hack: trying yo avoid turret LOS blocking by frames bug by trying to see target from vehicle boundary
390 // Or turret wallhack for turret's car
391 // TODO: to visibility checking another way, probably using 3D FOV
392 std::vector<tripoint> path_to_target = line_to( pos(), m->pos() );
393 path_to_target.insert( path_to_target.begin(), pos() );
394
395 // Getting point on vehicle boundaries and on line between target and turret
396 bool continueFlag = true;
397 do {
398 const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( path_to_target.back() );
399 vehicle *const veh = vp ? &vp->vehicle() : nullptr;
400 if( in_veh == veh ) {
401 continueFlag = false;
402 } else {
403 path_to_target.pop_back();
404 }
405 } while( continueFlag );
406
407 tripoint oldPos = pos();
408 setpos( path_to_target.back() ); //Temporary moving targeting npc on vehicle boundary postion
409 bool seesFromVehBound = sees( *m ); // And look from there
410 setpos( oldPos );
411 if( !seesFromVehBound ) {
412 continue;
413 }
414 } else {
415 continue;
416 }
417 }
418 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), m->pos() ) + 1; // rl_dist can be 0
419 if( dist > range + 1 || dist < area ) {
420 // Too near or too far
421 continue;
422 }
423 // Prioritize big, armed and hostile stuff
424 float mon_rating = m->power_rating();
425 float target_rating = mon_rating / dist;
426 if( mon_rating + hostile_adj <= 0 ) {
427 // We wouldn't attack it even if it was hostile
428 continue;
429 }
430
431 if( in_veh != nullptr && veh_pointer_or_null( here.veh_at( m->pos() ) ) == in_veh ) {
432 // No shooting stuff on vehicle we're a part of
433 continue;
434 }
435 if( area_iff && rl_dist( u.pos(), m->pos() ) <= area ) {
436 // Player in AoE
437 boo_hoo++;
438 continue;
439 }
440 // Hostility check can be expensive, but we need to inform the player of boo_hoo
441 // only when the target is actually "hostile enough"
442 bool maybe_boo = false;
443 if( angle_iff ) {
444 units::angle tangle = coord_to_angle( pos(), m->pos() );
445 units::angle diff = units::fabs( u_angle - tangle );
446 // Player is in the angle and not too far behind the target
447 if( ( diff + iff_hangle > 360_degrees || diff < iff_hangle ) &&
448 ( dist * 3 / 2 + 6 > pldist ) ) {
449 maybe_boo = true;
450 }
451 }
452 if( !maybe_boo && ( ( mon_rating + hostile_adj ) / dist <= best_target_rating ) ) {
453 // "Would we skip the target even if it was hostile?"
454 // Helps avoid (possibly expensive) attitude calculation
455 continue;
456 }
457 if( m->attitude_to( u ) == A_HOSTILE ) {
458 target_rating = ( mon_rating + hostile_adj ) / dist;
459 if( maybe_boo ) {
460 boo_hoo++;
461 continue;
462 }
463 }
464 if( target_rating <= best_target_rating || target_rating <= 0 ) {
465 continue; // Handle this late so that boo_hoo++ can happen
466 }
467 // Expensive check for proximity to vehicle
468 if( self_area_iff && overlaps_vehicle( in_veh->get_points(), m->pos(), area ) ) {
469 continue;
470 }
471
472 target = m;
473 best_target_rating = target_rating;
474 }
475 return target;
476}

◆ check_dead_state()

void Creature::check_dead_state ( )

This function checks the creatures is_dead_state and (if true) calls die.

You can either call this function after hitting this creature, or let the game call it during game::cleanup_dead. As die has many side effects (messages, on-death-triggers, ...), you should be careful when calling this and expect that at least a "The monster dies!" message might have been printed. If you want to print any message relating to the attack (e.g. how much damage has been dealt, how the attack was performed, what has been blocked...), do it before calling this function.

723 bp_hit = bodypart_str_id( "leg_l" );
724 } else {
725 bp_hit = bodypart_str_id( "leg_r" );
726 }
727 } else {
728 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
729 bp_hit = bodypart_str_id( "arm_l" );
730 } else {
731 bp_hit = bodypart_str_id( "arm_r" );
732 }
733 }
734 } else { // no crit logic for selecting bodypart
735 if( hit_value <= 0.4 && !one_in( 4 ) ) {
736 bp_hit = one_in( 3 ) ? bodypart_str_id( "head" ) : bodypart_str_id( "torso" );
737 } else if( one_in( 4 ) ) {
738 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
739 bp_hit = bodypart_str_id( "leg_l" );
740 } else {
741 bp_hit = bodypart_str_id( "leg_r" );
742 }
743 } else {
744 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
745 bp_hit = bodypart_str_id( "arm_l" );
746 } else {
747 bp_hit = bodypart_str_id( "arm_r" );
748 }
749 }
750 }
751
752
753 double damage_mult = 1.0;
754
755 ranged::hit_tier ht = ranged::hit_tier::normal;
756 if( magic ) {
757 damage_mult *= rng_float( 0.9, 1.1 );
758 } else if( targetted_crit_allowed && goodhit < accuracy_critical ) {
759 ht = ranged::hit_tier::critical;
760 damage_mult *= 1.5;
761 } else if( goodhit < accuracy_standard ) {
762 damage_mult *= rng_float( 0.9, 1.1 );
763 } else if( goodhit < accuracy_grazing ) {
764 ht = ranged::hit_tier::grazing;
765 damage_mult *= 0.5;
766 }
767
768 attack.missed_by = goodhit;
769
770 // copy it, since we're mutating
771 damage_instance impact = proj.impact;
772 if( damage_mult > 0.0f && proj.has_effect( ammo_effect_NO_DAMAGE_SCALING ) ) {
773 damage_mult = 1.0f;
774 }
775
776 impact.mult_damage( damage_mult );
777
778 if( proj.has_effect( ammo_effect_NOGIB ) ) {
779 float dmg_ratio = static_cast<float>( impact.total_damage() ) / get_hp_max( bp_hit );
780 if( dmg_ratio > 1.25f ) {
781 impact.mult_damage( 1.0f / dmg_ratio );
782 }
783 }
784
785 dealt_dam = deal_damage( source, bp_hit, impact );
786 dealt_dam.bp_hit = bp_hit->token;
787
788 // Apply ammo effects to target.
789 if( proj.has_effect( ammo_effect_TANGLE ) ) {
790 monster *z = dynamic_cast<monster *>( this );
791 player *n = dynamic_cast<player *>( this );
792 // if its a tameable animal, its a good way to catch them if they are running away, like them ranchers do!
793 // we assume immediate success, then certain monster types immediately break free in monster.cpp move_effects()
794 if( z ) {
795 const item &drop_item = proj.get_drop();
796 if( !drop_item.is_null() ) {
797 z->add_effect( effect_tied, 1_turns, num_bp );
798 z->tied_item = cata::make_value<item>( drop_item );
799 } else {
800 add_msg( m_debug, "projectile with TANGLE effect, but no drop item specified" );
801 }
802 } else if( n && !is_immune_effect( effect_downed ) ) {
803 // no tied up effect for people yet, just down them and stun them, its close enough to the desired effect.
804 // we can assume a person knows how to untangle their legs eventually and not panic like an animal.
805 add_effect( effect_downed, 1_turns );
806 // stunned to simulate staggering around and stumbling trying to get the entangled thing off of them.
807 add_effect( effect_stunned, rng( 3_turns, 8_turns ) );
808 }
809 }
810 if( proj.has_effect( ammo_effect_INCENDIARY ) ) {
811 if( made_of( material_id( "veggy" ) ) || made_of_any( cmat_flammable ) ) {
812 add_effect( effect_onfire, rng( 2_turns, 6_turns ), bp_hit->token );
813 } else if( made_of_any( cmat_flesh ) && one_in( 4 ) ) {
814 add_effect( effect_onfire, rng( 1_turns, 4_turns ), bp_hit->token );
815 }
816 } else if( proj.has_effect( ammo_effect_IGNITE ) ) {
817 if( made_of( material_id( "veggy" ) ) || made_of_any( cmat_flammable ) ) {
818 add_effect( effect_onfire, 6_turns, bp_hit->token );
819 } else if( made_of_any( cmat_flesh ) ) {
820 add_effect( effect_onfire, 10_turns, bp_hit->token );
821 }
822 }
823
824 if( bp_hit == bodypart_str_id( "head" ) && proj.has_effect( ammo_effect_BLINDS_EYES ) ) {
825 // TODO: Change this to require bp_eyes
826 add_env_effect( effect_blind, bp_eyes, 5, rng( 3_turns, 10_turns ) );
827 }
828
829 if( proj.has_effect( ammo_effect_APPLY_SAP ) ) {
830 add_effect( effect_sap, 1_turns * dealt_dam.total_damage() );
831 }
832 if( proj.has_effect( ammo_effect_PARALYZEPOISON ) && dealt_dam.total_damage() > 0 ) {
833 add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You feel poison coursing through your body!" ) );
834 add_effect( effect_paralyzepoison, 5_minutes );
835 }
836
837 int stun_strength = 0;
838 if( proj.has_effect( ammo_effect_BEANBAG ) ) {
839 stun_strength = 4;
840 }
841 if( proj.has_effect( ammo_effect_LARGE_BEANBAG ) ) {
842 stun_strength = 16;
843 }
844 if( stun_strength > 0 ) {
845 switch( get_size() ) {
846 case MS_TINY:
847 stun_strength *= 4;
848 break;
849 case MS_SMALL:
850 stun_strength *= 2;
851 break;
852 case MS_MEDIUM:
853 default:
854 break;
855 case MS_LARGE:
856 stun_strength /= 2;
857 break;
858 case MS_HUGE:
859 stun_strength /= 4;
860 break;
861 }
862 add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns * rng( stun_strength / 2, stun_strength ) );
863 }
864
865 if( u_see_this ) {
866 if( damage_mult == 0 ) {
867 if( source != nullptr ) {
868 add_msg( source->is_player() ? _( "You miss!" ) : _( "The shot misses!" ) );
869 }
870 } else {
871 ranged::print_dmg_msg( *this, source, dealt_dam, ht );
872 }
873 }
874
875 check_dead_state();
876 attack.hit_critter = this;
877 attack.missed_by = goodhit;
878}

◆ sees() [1/2]

virtual

The functions check whether this creature can see the target.

The target may either be another creature (critter), or a specific point on the map.

The function that take another creature as input should check visibility of that creature (e.g. not digging, or otherwise invisible). They must than check whether the location of the other monster is visible.

◆ store()

void Creature::store ( JsonOut &  jsout) const
protected

These two functions are responsible for storing and loading the members of this class to/from json data.

All classes that inherit from this class should implement their own version of these functions. They are not virtual on purpose, as it's not needed. Every implementation of those functions should a) call the same function with the same parameters of the super class and b) store/load their own members, but not members of any sub or super class.

The functions are (on purpose) not part of the json serialize/deserialize system (defined in json.h). The Creature class is incomplete, there won't be any instance of that class alone, but there will be instances of sub classes (e.g. player, monster). Those (complete) classes implement the deserialize/serialize interface of json. That way only one json object per npc/player/monster instance is created (inside of the serialize function). E.g. player::serialize() looks like this: json.start_object();store(json);json.end_object() player::store than stores the members of the player class, and it calls Character::store, which stores the members of the Character class and calls Creature::store, which stores the members of the Creature class. All data goes into the single json object created in player::serialize.
